item.title: ResNets Explained - Solving Deep Network Degradation with Residual Learning
item.description:
Introduction

Deep convolutional neural networks have been around for a while and have completely revolutionized how we tackle image recognition task in computer vision. When AlexNet came out in 2012 it revolutionized how we use CNN’s as it was the first time we saw an architecture with consecutive Convolutional Layers with significant improvement in training speed and performance which it did by leveraging deeper architecture and GPU accelaration.This 8 layer deep CNN was one of first to have this kind of performance for a largescale image classification.
